Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member McMahon.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrew's Roman Catholic Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y.  10007.

Council Member McMahon moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gioia moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 25, October 9, October 25, November 7, November 20, November 25 (Recessed Meeting), December 4, and December 18, 2002 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the legislature of the State of New York to pass Senate bill S.271 and Assembly bill A.1427 of the 2003-2004 regular session, acts to amend the state finance law, the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating the New York city parks, tree and urban forestry fund.
Items.MatterName: Creating the New York city parks, tree and urban forestry fund. (S.0271)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express to refrain from advertising their credit card services on the website of the "National Alliance," and from doing business with this organization, which is a well-known neo-Nazi group.
Items.MatterName: Calling upon Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express to refrain from advertising their credit card services on the website of the "National Alliance"

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City Council to strongly oppose President Bush's re-nomination of Charles Pickering to the appellate court and commend the Congressional Black Caucus, Senator Charles Schumer and Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton for their opposition to such re-nomination.
Items.MatterName: Council to strongly oppose President Bush's re-nomination of Charles Pickering to the appellate court.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing February 5, 2003 as National Girls and Women in Sports Day.
Items.MatterName: National Girls and Women in Sports Day, February 5, 2003

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing February 7, 2003 as National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day.
Items.MatterName: National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day, February 7, 2003

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collective bargaining rights of traffic enforcement agents and sanitation enforcement agents.
Items.MatterName: Collective bargaining rights of traffic enforcement agents and sanitation enforcement agents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to littering to include all premises in the citywide routing system.
Items.MatterName: Littering to include all premises in the citywide routing system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of notification of inability to deliver mail or packages.
Items.MatterName: Posting of notification of inability to deliver mail or packages.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to violations of the noise code that pertain to the operation of motorcycles.
Items.MatterName: Violations of the noise code that pertain to motorcycles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring protective devices for seniors and disabled persons who reside in multiple dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Requiring protective devices for seniors and disabled persons who reside in multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exhibitionist behavior on motorcycles.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale, installation and use of motorcycle straight pipes.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale, installation and use of motorcycle straight pipes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prevention of noisy and offensive motorcycles.
Items.MatterName: Prevention of noisy and offensive motorcycles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of notices of provisions of the human rights law.
Items.MatterName: Posting of notices of provisions of the human rights law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct oversight hearings to examine the consequences of aggressive motorcycling on City streets and to explore ways to the make the streets safer for both drivers and pedestrians.
Items.MatterName: Conduct oversight hearings to examine the consequences of aggressive motorcycling on City streets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the filing of deeds containing restrictive covenants.
Items.MatterName: Filing of deeds containing restrictive covenants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enhancing enforcement of the prohibition against drivers of for-hire vehicles accepting passengers without telephone contract or prearrangement.
Items.MatterName: Enhancing enforcement of the prohibition against drivers of for-hire vehicles accepting passengers without telephone contract or prearrangement.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon President Bush and the Congress of the United States of America to maintain the current level of funding for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program for Fiscal Year 2003 and not decrease it by 300 million dollars.
Items.MatterName: President Bush and the Congress of the United States of America to maintain the current level of funding for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of a performance bond for the new construction of one-, two- or three-family dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Posting of a performance bond for the new construction of one-, two- or three-family dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring dogs to be restrained by a leash or chain unless otherwise authorized by the commissioner of the department of parks and recreation, or any other law, rule or regulation.
Items.MatterName: Requiring dogs to be restrained by a leash or chain.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing President Bush's decision to dishonor the work and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. on the occasion of the slain civil rights leader's birthday by injecting his administration into the affirmative action case pending before the Supreme Court.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Denouncing President Bush's decision to dishonor the work and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosure of the use of pre-recorded music at live performances.
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of the use of pre-recorded music at live performances.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the City Council to conduct hearings on the inequity of the disparate treatment under the State Real Property Tax Law between residences which are one-, two- or three-family homes and therefore given the preferential property tax treatment afforded to class one properties, and those which are residences owned in the cooperative or condominium form and are afforded less favorable treatment.
Items.MatterName: The inequity of the disparate treatment under the State Real Property Tax Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring rifle and shotgun owners to obtain yearly liability insurance.
Items.MatterName: Requiring rifle and shotgun owners to obtain yearly liability insurance.

Items.Title: Resolution, calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Environmental Conservation Law to provide for New York City Agencies to enforce the mandatory redemption provisions of the Returnable Container Law and to provide that violations of said law may serve as a basis for denial of any state or local licensees and permits needed by the violating business to operate.
Resolution urging the New York State Assembly to amend A09255 to require that gun owners obtain liability insurance for each firearm owned.
Items.MatterName: Require that gun owners obtain liability insurance for each firearm owned. (A.09255)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating the crime of gang recruitment.
Items.MatterName: Creating the crime of gang recruitment.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend various sections of the Penal Law to better combat gang violence.
Items.MatterName: Amend various sections of the Penal Law to better combat gang violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the permissible printing, imprinting, or stenciling on sign awnings and street canopies.
Items.MatterName: Permissible printing, imprinting, or stenciling on sign awnings and street canopies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the Department of Transportation’s designated truck routes.
Items.MatterName: Designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the DOT's designated truck routes.
